name: GoogleAIModel

input.content:
In freecad I want to have a circle but only for reference not to actually be a circle but just so I can line up other lines to make a hexagon for example.
How do I do that?

output:
**Creating a Reference Circle in FreeCAD:**

1. **Open FreeCAD:** Launch the FreeCAD software on your computer.

2. **Create a New Document:** Click on "File" > "New" to create a new FreeCAD document.

3. **Switch to Sketch View:** Click on the "Sketcher" icon located on the left-hand toolbar. This will switch to the Sketch view.

4. **Insert a Circle:** Click on the "Circle" icon located on the Sketch toolbar.

5. **Draw the Circle:** Use your mouse to draw a circle on the sketch plane. You can hold down the "Ctrl" key to constrain the circle to be perfect.

6. **Set the Circle as a Reference:** Right-click on the circle and select "Set as Reference". This will remove the circle from the sketch geometry but will keep it visible for reference purposes.

**Using the Reference Circle to Create a Hexagon:**

1. **Draw Construction Lines:** Use the "Construction Line" tool (located on the Sketch toolbar) to draw lines that intersect the reference circle. These lines will serve as the sides of the hexagon.

2. **Use the Reference Circle for Alignment:** Align the construction lines with the reference circle to ensure that the hexagon shape is accurate.

3. **Draw the Hexagon:** Use the "Line" tool to connect the construction lines, forming the hexagon shape.

**Note:**

* Reference geometry will not be exported or included in the final model. It serves only as a visual guide to assist in design.
* To hide or show reference geometry, right-click on it and select "Hide Reference" or "Show Reference".
